parameters.name: deployment_id
parameters.description: Can be a deployment's id (integer) or name (string)

post.summary:
This endpoint is a placeholder for generating our own access tokens.
Right now, it is a no-op for the token.
Version 1 of the token is the WorkOS access token

post.description: Unlink a secondary identity from a user's account

get.description: List all identities for a user
List simplified identities grouped by WorkOS user ID

parameters.description: The client ID of the OAuth app to regenerate the secret for

get.description: Get candidate email addresses to be WorkOS admins.
Check if a deployment has an associated WorkOS team

post.description: Provision a WorkOS team for a Convex team

AuditLogActor.description:
Represents the `ValidatedActor` equivalent for audit logs. This identifies
who executed an AuditLogEvent

AuditLogResponse.description:
Struct that contains the result of a query to the audit_logs table. The
`events` field contains all of the `AuditLog` values and the `cursor` field
denotes where to resume the query if more results are needed.

authnToken.description: Authentication token is expected to be the access token from WorkOS
Authentication token is expected to be the access token from WorkOS

code.description: A code that the application can use to retrieve the token

accessToken.description: a serialized access token that the CLI will send back up

oneOf.description: WorkOS environment info if it exists for this deployment
Team info if the team has WorkOS configured

adminConvexEmail.description:
Email of Convex team member who created the WorkOS account.
This field should always be present when has_associated_workos_team is
true.

adminEmail.description:
Email address used to provision the WorkOS account. This field should
always be present if has_associated_workos_team is true.

adminName.description:
Name of Convex team member who created the WorkOS account.
This field is optional even when has_associated_workos_team is true.

InstanceName.description:
Example instance names:

tall-sheep-123

test-tall-sheep-123  # Prefix of test for internal testing

domain.description: The custom domain name to delete.

requestDestination.description: The destination for this custom domain (convexCloud or convexSite).

email.description:
Email address to use for the WorkOS team admin,
must be a verified email address associated with the user's account

teamId.description: Convex team ID, no WorkOS team exists at this point

accessToken.description: Authentication token is expected to be the access token from WorkOS

SerializedAccessToken.description:
ConvexAccessToken is our own internal notion of authorization.
It is versioned.

V1 - uses an WorkOS access token for authorization.

Serialization is done by SerializedAccessToken::new
The ConvexAccessToken is serialized (json) and base64
encoded for obfuscation before sending it to the client

Deserialization is done by SerializedAccessToken::decode
This reverses the process and returns a ConvexAccessToken which
can be match'd by the extractor.

`SerializedAccessToken` is intentionally the only struct that is
left public.

The json is externally tagged. Expect it to look like
{"v1": "workostoken"}

environments.description: List of WorkOS environments for deployments

oneOf.description: WorkOS team association info, if it exists
